title: Permabanned almost a year ago...
body:
Twas completely deserved, however, I was hoping I could ask a rioter to re-consider one final chance. I was having a **really** rough time period in my life back then and took it out on people in league. I know I said stuff that was unacceptable, however, I have almost completely reformed(every off 15th-20th game i might have a small blow up, nothing like before, before i promptly mute). Ive been playing most of the time on another account(as suggested by riot support) and haven't had a single chat restriction on it yet.  There is a LOT of value worth in skins on the account, and I'd really appreciate some love. I can give you my accounts name if you would like to review the chat history over the past year-ish on it.

Sincerely,
RawEchoes

Ps. Im sorry for being a filthy fizz main, im working on reforming that next =S
pss. Riots obviously dodging this so rip any efforts.

As a fellow-in-arms of the reform club, you have my support.

actually, thats a good idea. when you are banned it should give you the ability to make a new account linked to that one and when you go about 6-12 months without any punishment while still being somewhat active, your first account in unbanned

No it is not a good idea.

Riot can not be sure that the same person is playing on the linked account.

However what can be done; Riot should give the ability to log in in to a permabaned account after 6 months and gift away your RP purchased items, or refund them to 50% value and give away the RP.

In order this not to be abused for selling stuff; 

* You can gift only one item per friend, like skins to a player that has at least 30 games or so played in a party with the banned account - he really has to be a friend.

* The 50% RP can be given only in whole to an account that is newer then the permabaned date of the gifting account with riot support help .

* You can give more then one skin to an single account that is newer then the permabaned date of the gifting account with riot support help.
Why should a permabanned account be able to do something that you can't do with an account that is in good standing?
Permabanned accounts can already do 1 thing better than nonbanned accounts - they make it easier to quit

Riot doesn't just ban you straight away. They warn you and give you time to reform.  He ignored that warning and paid the price.  Sure, he had a rough time in his life, but a warning is a warning.  

Believe it or not there are people out there that have shitty lives but don't take it out on people here in league.
Believe it or not people express emotions in different ways.

I just said that.  People not taking it out on others is different than taking it out on others.

Anywho, keep it up on the downvotes.

Actually, nowhere did you say that. If you could point out where you explained that people express emotions in different ways, your entire argument would topple over. i.e; Your argument is that not everyone who has "shitty lives" take it out on league. Well, if you acknowledge that people express emotions in different ways you'd have to concede that taking it out on League is a valid way to vent and that change can also happen. Riot gives warnings, sure, but not time to reform. If a player is toxic in every single game for two weeks he could probably be banned due to the amount of reports and, if you didn't know, not many crises or stressful situations resolve in two weeks. You just sound like an entitled person who never got angry because you're used to getting what you want, tbh.

If you know it can happen, you must also know that **different people take different amounts of time to reform.** Just because you live in a bubble doesn't mean the outside world doesn't happen. News flash, **you can't just get over depression or a family tragedy in the amount of time that Riot gives you to reform.** You rage, get banned for a day, get back on, ban for a week, and then ban forever. While I'm happy to see you have reformed, if they were to change the stance and even give one more person another chance, they would have to do it for a another, that is why when they said permanent, they meant it, I do wish you the best on this account though, truly.

This account was also permabanned a year ago. In addition I was Diamond 3 at the time playing every day with the likes of Nightblu3 and Annie Bot in my games.  I ran into one singular toxic player that I got 4 games in a row (this happens in Diamond 3) and he intentionally trolled me 4 games in a row while being incredibly toxic and spam adding me on separate accounts telling me to "kill myself" to the point where Riot told me don't add anyone I don't know (instead of actually punishing the guy)

I took this as they don't care and went on a toxic rampage and got permabanned after never stopping playing (because at Diamond 3 you literally have to play every day to maintain your mechanics)

I never got that good again. I never returned to Diamond 3 level of play, and that account I had(with all runes/all rune pages and all champions) never got returned and I never made a whine thread asking for it back, just accepted it was gone.

I really have mixed feelings on this, while I see at as a great idea, allowing players to get their accounts back after a proven amount of time...I also think back to my past on LoL, years ago when I had just started, the players who made me almost fear playing this game, and the reason I didn't touch ranked games for 3 years...knowing players like that could get their accounts back, after the amount of trauma and stress they may have put on their teammates (or even enemies) fully knowing the risks...I almost feel compelled to say they deserve to live with their choices. Of course, they can just play on an alt, but with that said, they've already faced the consequences and hopefully won't be re-making that same mistake, and for the people like that, of course I have no qualm with them getting their accounts back...but what about the people who haven't changed? They get their account back, and cause just as much trauma as they did before? Sometimes a 2nd chance is too much to risk. I also hardly believe you don't get warned a few times, if not a time-ban, for what you've done, and you fully know its wrong.

Being on the recieiving end of the shit i get that too. Its disheartening, and makes you want to spew stuff back at them. The system just changed to the 4 strike thing when i got my permaban, and it seemed like everyone was being toxic, so i would too... not a good logic but its what i used. Now that i know toxicity was a big deal... and tbh got in touch with my humanity while online... I'm not only better at the game because i get angry less, It feels better to win without getting angry at every little thing.
Best way ive seen is to make a new account and get  an honorable banner or friendly banner. Then show proof of ownership and show them the reform.

This is not a bunch of pixels. There are people in either sides of the screen and, if I call your mother a whore (just an example), the fact that those words are pixels won't make it any less of a disrespect. And you may not care about random people insulting you, but most people do.

Anyways, try to go to your job each day having to stand random strangers insulting you for those 8 hours every day for no reason at all, maybe trying to troll you just for fun, because that's what playing League looks like most of the games.

I know is a bit off-topic, but we should really stop calling "bunch of pixels" to anything in the Internet to justify toxic behaviour.

I don't know about a year-old account, but my own permaban was two months ago and my account still exists.

There is a reason they won't give you your account back even if you have reformed.

If you were living alone in this planet, then you'd get your account back because you probably deserve it, but you don't and doing so would unleash a barrage of players requesting for their accounts to be unbanned, pushing the limits further and further each time. If you got your account back, then why this player whose case is *almost* as good as yours doesn't? And, if they do, why the next player whose case is *almost* as good as them doesn't? You get the idea.

Also, other people would think that permabans aren't *that* bad, because there is a chance you get it back and that makes it feel less punishing overall.

And ultimately, some people would be toxic, then act as honorable players for some time to get their account back, and then become toxic again, knowing that they can 'get back' their accounts by holding themselves for some time.

tl;dr: Doing so would set a precedent that would make some people try to abuse the system and a lot others, include RIOTERs, feel bad.
